Definition: In this task, you are given two phrases, Head and Tail, which are events possibly involving participants. PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head is a part, portion, or makeup of the Tail or not. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No".
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Physical Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The Head is made of the Tail.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX asks ___ to go with PersonY<sep>Tail: follows the other person
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, The relation between the Head and the Tail is different, and the Head is not made up of the Tail. So the output should be"No".
In this example, the government is made of the police. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.explanation: In this example, The Head needs the Tail, and it is not made up of the Tail. So the output should be "No".
The war is made up of aggression, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX asks PersonY's grandma<sep>Tail: an advice.
Head: PersonX answers the door<sep>Tail: excited
Head: PersonX asks PersonX's mother for help<sep>Tail: To call mother
Head: PersonX answers PersonY question<sep>Tail: helped
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to say<sep>Tail: curious
Head: PersonX asks ___ to go with PersonY<sep>Tail: considers another direction
